intro: Varronia mariguitensis, commonly known as the Mariguitensis varronia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, oval berries that contain several seeds. Varronia mariguitensis is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and undergrowth.
